page.title: 19CORNISH IDIOM, TRURO AREA
page.content: The Cornish accent is flourishing, & idioms are widely used by all ages. Cornish language classes are readily available,encouraged by several groups and Cornish drama and dance has been revived in recent years. "My dear life!" & "Oh,my crumbs!" are exclamations. "Dear of 'un": said affectionately of young children. "My 'andsome":everyday form of address To"belong" to do something= to be accustomed to do it. To "clunk"= to swallow. An "emmet"= an ant. Used derogatively for non-Cornish people, especially in holiday season."Non-emmet"car-stickers are seen. "D'rec'ly"= soon. "Proper job!" expresses approval. "A' right?" is a usual greeting. "Can't be first as last"= you can't have everything.
